title: Download ASAP
review:
Best thing on the market. 
If you're new to area you can definitely met new people or get acquainted with the location that you're in.
Customer service is top of the charts and guess what?! Real people! 
I also love how patient, loyal and committed they are with their customers!
Love this app!

title: Fever
review: It seems to work fine and it does everything it says it does. I'm sure I'll be able to use this some time in the near future with my friends since we only live a couple hours from NYC. I'll be sure to show them the app. Seems like a pretty cool app.

title: NOOOO
review: HORRIBLE went to an event that was supposed to be open till late it was CLOSED then accidentally purchased the wrong voucher and ended up going to the burger place expecting it to be a restaurant or at least a good ¬£10 deal turns out it wasn't a deal AT ALL for the place was a fast food burger place and the menu had the items already listed as ¬£10 in addition to having the worst burger and curly fries I have ever had in my life. Sunday wasted by using fever you're better of getting groupon deals. Never Again.

title: Never be bored again!
review: I love this app so much, it‚Äôs the easiest way to find a good solid listing of things going on day by day in the city. So many events, a lot of which are free, and lots of special deals (like drink specials) that come with signing up on the list through Fever.

title: Loving this app
review: This app always has great deals and they're really cheaper than other websites (I've asked others who attended the same event as I did who purchased tickets from other sites). Glad they allow you to follow more than 3 hashtags now

title: Incredible app
review:
I've been using this app for a few weeks and it's incredible. I've had a blast 4 weekends in a row because of tickets I got off this app. 

I've been telling my friends about it and will definitely continue using it!

title: Awesome App!
review: This app really has a variety of things to do in your area! It also helps that it shows which of your friends are going to which event as well! It makes it easy to find out about things to do on the go!

title: Fever is a dope app plain and simple
review: When ever your looking for that event that is just hot and popping and you want to have fun all night this is my go to app to use. I went to a couple of rooftop bar events and some lounge party's as well and they all where fun in the city.

title: 3 horrible support experiences in a row!
review: The concept is cool but the customer support is absolutely horrible. I've had three separate occasions where support was unable or unwilling to help at all even when they were clearly at fault. Venue management even attempted to call them to rectify the situation and even he ended up being unhappy and apologetic for their lack of basic support. Also no refunds are allowed so I'm out more than $100 for things that's they are unwilling to support. Stay away.

title: Great App.. bad customer service
review:
Great app, very handy. But the customer service is absolutely horrible. 
I called customer service, and the woman I spoke to was rude and completely useless. Supposedly there was no one else I can talk to. 
Make sure you delete you payment methods each time you make a purchase. It will not give you an option for the payment options you have on your profile, it chooses one for you.

title: Great app
review: This is a great app for finding plans for the next few days, at different price points. The only suggestions would be to add an option to look for events on a certain day in the future, i.e. A week in advance

title: Honest opinion
review: Straight forward with no hassles, only minor setback is it being last minute but what is more better than thinking on the fly versus planning a week in advance?? The last minute pressure keeps it fun and exciting

title: great app
review: I downloaded the app on and really this is a very useful application , I can participate in events connected with everyone, I just installed login and choose three topics that interest me then this app will help your suggestions . I am very pleased with this app !

title: It was cool until it started opening up at random times
review: This app has a lot of potential me and my girlfriend always say that we can never know of everything going on in NY and this app shows you events tailored to what you like to do, but my love slowly turned to frustration when it opened up while I was sending a text, the last straw was when it interrupted my fapping session..2 stars

title: Worst app
review: This is the worst app. Contrary to what it wants you to believe- it will ruin your evening out and result in great disappointment. This app does not get you into any events and frequently posts false information. In one night, my friend and I tried to attend two events posted on fever, we even paid to skip the line for one of the events, only to learn at both venues that fever didn't even put us on the list to get in. Basically, this is a scam and do not download it.

title: Great app to have
review: There's nothing better then opening the app and seeing things to do right off the bat. This app is hands down the most useful when it comes to figuring out what you want to do for the day.

title: Customer service on point
review: I had an issue being a first time user and they responded quickly and we're ready to take care of my needs. Very pleased with the service

title: Applications or
review: This is a good app and is great for me. Nice interface and very easy to use. Convenient for me to participate in events organized by the city. It helps me to quickly see the information that the event will be held in his city, and I am willing to participate.

title: Hashtags
review: We should be able to choose as many hashtags as we want, so that we can view a variety of events. I hate having to change my hashtags daily to be able to see the events I may want to go to. That's the only issue I have with the app , otherwise I love it!

title: Good App!
review: Applied well, it may give me a curated lish of the most interesting events happening in the city of London. If likened notebook personal guide most detailed way, it can provide a list of culinary-based exchanges and my social connections. I liked it, thank you very much.

title: Customer service
review: This is a really cool app if you just come to the city, you don't know too many people, and you are looking for something to do. The customer service people are really nice and considerate.

title: Fun
review: It's really good, provides you with the list of different options from food, party, sports and many more. As you have selected, it determines the type of event for you. Some are even free! I'm enjoying it! Keep up the good work.

title: Unreal!
review: I've been looking for something like this to stay in the know in a big city. Every weekend I can go to a new, different, and hip spot. Whether it be just for the music, food, the art, I always have a good time

title: Amazing app
review: This app is simply amazing always up to date in events at very affordable venue. Only thing bad I have to say is that it only gives you 3 selection to pick. I love doing other things as well.

title: Great for NYC
review: Good app if you live in the NYC area, tells you what's going on and makes it cheaper to go out. It can sometimes eliminate cover charges for the most expensive/ hottest bars in the city! Only worth it if you are 21+ though. Cool app!

title: This app did not work for me
review: First of all this barely qualifies as a rooftop bar at four stories high. We were told by the app that cover was free, but that only applied to females (like any club) and we came as a couple and they wanted to charge my guy $20 bucks. Totally false advertising for an app that is supposed to save you money. We didn't even go in because it was so unappealing. It makes me question all the other events on this app.

title: This app is awesome!!
review: I got it and at first thought it was another commercial app. But as I was using it I realized this app is great. I can always find something fun to do that day. A lot of the events are free too. Must have app for fun, adventure loving people.

title: Slightly Dissapointed
review: I don't like that fact that I have to sign into social network accounts that I don't use, deleted, or have deactivated in the past in order to use the app. It seems like a great app, but I won't be using it because I refuse to sign into social network accounts that I hate having.

title: Cool but...
review:
I wish they had a longer list of things to do for "later". Its awesome though! Who would've known there's so much going on in NYC! üëØ

Also!!!!!!!! : 

Their customer service is amazing! Do give this app a try!

title: Makes every weekend exciting
review: After living in New York for 7 years. I feel like I've done everything. Fever helps show you there is even more than you thought!

title: Use it in NYC
review: I've gone to a couple art galleries through Fever. There are a lot of options, I'm pretty busy with class and work, but it's nice to know that if I have a night off that there's plenty for me to do. Great app.

title: Great find üëå
review:
Get $7 - sign up with ANMARIES1 ;)

Find myself using it quite a bit. I like that it has a variety of options... They're lots of free things to do too for when you're broke and bored!

title: BEST APP IN NYC!!!
review: Fever makes going out seamless.  There are so many events on the app that I would have never found out about otherwise. It makes coordinating nights out with your friends fun and easy! Must download!!

title: It's perfect!!
review: This app is perfect! No exaggeration. It has so many options from hitting the club scenery or hitting a museum or film festival in the city! Affordable and easy places to get to if you know your way around the city. Only wish I knew of this earlier when summer first began.

title: Incredible discoveries
review: I love this app becomes it slows to find new places and events that I have never heard of before. Everyone should have this app. Wish I would have found it sooner.

title: If you don't know what to do!
review: This is the app for you! Seriously helps find fun things to do in your city. And no I'm not paid to write this, wish I was because I'd get paid for writing the truth.

title: Love it!
review: My husband and I never know what to do on Tuesdays nights‚Ä¶Fever always has good  events weeknights. Yplan is also good. I like that you can see people‚Äôs profiles on this app though. Gives you a feel for the crowd.

title: So far so good!
review: I have been seeing a lot of great events. Nothing where I live, but I'm normally in New York city once a month, so this app has came in handy in finding new things to do. Even things that you normally wouldn't do. My con is they need more cities.

title: The. Worst.
review: Interesting platform to check out what's going on, but that's about it. Got tickets for the "VIP Yacht Cruise" last night and it was awful. When we arrived we were told to get in a line to actually get our tickets, which was a mob, there were no $5 drink specials as advertised, and there was nothing VIP about the experience. I feel that Fever misrepresented the event and will never book through them again.

title: Amazing! I love Fever!
review: I'm obsessed with this app! All of my life rolled into one place! A great way to find out about new events happening in the city and sharing it with friends! 10 out of 10! Keep it up!

title: The Hudson
review: First of all this barely qualifies as a rooftop bar at four stories high. We were told by the app that cover was free, but that only applied to females (like any club) and we came as a couple and they wanted to charge my guy $20 bucks. Totally false advertising for an app that is supposed to save you money. We didn't even go in because it was so unappealing. It makes me question all the other events on this app.

title: Would like to stay signed in to the app
review: Still new to the app and like it thus far. The only annoying thing is it doesn't keep me signed it when I close the app. Let me stay signed in unless I choose to log out.

title: Hey app developer type people
review: Oh my gosh guess what?!!! Not everyone has a Facebook account. Also, not everyone want to link their social media account to every app we download. So while I would have loved to check out your app, it's impossible because I deleted Facebook years ago. Also, why were you advertising on Twitter if Twitter is not even a method one could use to sign in? Anyway boo!

title: Good so far
review: Had no idea what to do for the day and fever gives you so many options and ideas. Great app so far. I'll be attending my first function tonight so, let's see how it goes.

title: I like it
review: Opened my mind to a lot , great for last minute plans ! Me and my husband are going on a date to a comedy show after all our friends canceled on us

title: Great for finding stuff in NYC
review: Always checking fever to get ideas, figure out stuff to do. App works great and it looks like a lot of people use it. Highly recommend.

title: A great app!
review: Love this app. I have been using it for 2 weeks now and I love how it keeps me updated on things going on near me (NYC). Definitely have recommended it to a few friends!

title: Fever, steering away from the known
review: Awesome app, even as a NY native it helps me stay informed on some great events that aren't "buzzing" in the media. I‚Äôve been going out more on the weekdays because of it now too.

title: Fever review
review: Pretty cool app, I‚Äôve some old friends that I found on this app I didn‚Äôt even know that were still in the city. Like the fact that you can see people

title: Pretty cool
review: NYC native here - I'm digging this app so far. Pretty good deals around the city. Gives you access to free events and the specials at paid locations are pretty affordable as well. I suggest trying it out!

title: Improved my social life
review: This app introduced me to fun events and chic places and activities that I hadn't discovered in NYC. Also, the events are extremely budget friendly. Download the app now.

title: Great access to what's going at great prices!
review: I've only been a user for a few months but it's awesome to use an app like this whenever I'm trying to figure out what to do on any given night! Keep up the good work Fever!

title: I Enjoy It
review: I'm actually a fan of this app.  I discovered it through a friend and have found it easy to use and helpful for discovering new things to do, go, eat (of course, haha).

title: Great stuff
review: Fever has come through in the clutch so many times. Whether it be date ideas, out of town mets in search of something new yorky or just some Sunday funday spots.

title: ADD A SAVE EVENT BUTTON
review: Great app but I think would be best if you guys added a "save event" but in just in case customers are not ready to buy but still interested in the event. Especially because you have reoccurring events on different nights.

title: Great App
review: Whoever created this app is awesome. Using this app a great for exploring your city. It's has a variety of places to choose from with low pricing. It's cool to know what interesting and fun stuff is going on out there.

title: Awesome
review: It tells you all the things you wish you could know about your city! It's like having the major "in" to all the hot spots and events! Must say whoever invented this app. Genius üëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ

title: Fever
review: This app really let's me check in with my city. Sometimes I just like to get up and go and I love that I can always find something so quickly. I got the fever!

title: Great first impression, but wish it had a few more options..
review:
I downloaded this app for our frequent trips to NYC.  I initially loved it, but wished it had a few features:

1. It would be great if it would let me change my hashtags...but it will not save them, no matter how many times I try to change them!

2. It would be even better if you could select more than three hashtags!

3. It would be the best if you could swipe left on the events and delete any of them that don't interest you!

Thanks :)

title: Always know what is hot in the city!
review: This app is great! I always find fun things to do with it. I can also follow my friends so we can to see what everyone is doing in New York.

title: Buggy/Huge waste of time.
review: Just spent too long authenticating both Facebook and Google. After my logins are "successful" it loops me back to the same screen, to start over and try again. It's an infinite loop. The app now has access to my personal Google and Facebook information, while I have no access to anything other than the pre login welcome screen.

title: Best App for Anything Entertainment
review: This app is absolutely great, just like a Groupon for events in the city. The food is also amazing and I hope that more variety come out soon.

title: Soo helpful
review: Never have I been able to experience the city like I can now with this app. This is deff the next big thing I'm forcing everyone I know to get it

title: Fever
review: One of the apps I use the most, for sure. You can share plans now which makes things much easier.

title: Age!
review: This is an amazing way of finding plans, I just wish there was a setting that would let you adjust the age requirement because some events are only 21+ and not all of us are 21. üòÖ

title: Promoters...
review: The nerve of these promoters. I was at queens center mall and this guy literally forced my group and I to download this app. Then when we walked away, he cursed at us. Sorry you can't get a real job. Please get better promoters. This girl also came to my group and spoke to us for half an hour and would not leave when we were clearly not interested. Again, get better promoters. Thanks.

title: LOVE THIS APP
review: This has been so helpful whenever trying to find a place to go and have fun with my friends!! Absolutely love it! recommend it to anyone looking to spice up their weekend life :)

title: Fever nyc!
review: This app is amazing, never any dull nights in the city because I can just check the app and it has countless options for me to choose from!

title: I can't even open the app
review: This is the second time that I've downloaded this app and after trying to login both with my Facebook and my Gmail account it keeps saying that I'm off-line when I'm clearly connected to Internet. I would love to take advantage of this app and it's offers but unfortunately I can't because it's not letting me in

title: Scam
review: Saw a Facebook add about a list of 8 amazing date spots which seemed cool but when I tapped the add I was directed to download page. Thinking I would get to see the 8 date spots if I had the app I downloaded it but it seems everything was just a scam to get you to download it and force you to log in with Facebook, no list anywhere. Add money well spent by the developer, app deleted.

title: Game changer for finding events!
review: It's so easy to use and curates awesome events that are happening around to my interests. Definitely worth checking out.

title: Awesome app
review: I love this app! You can always find something to do and it's way better than browsing on Google for plans

title: Awesome App
review: There's always something to do in NYC, now I can make plans with friends and try out all the things my city has to offer. Love it.

title: Fever App
review: This is perfect app for anyone looking for fun and interesting plans in NYC. I use it all the time! This is definitely something you should get. You'd be surprised how useful it is!

title: Never works
review: I downloaded this app because I always saw great things on Facebook, but needed the app to see the articles/events. However, every time I click on them now that I actually have the app, they never go through and I'm left searching to find what I saw on Facebook.

title: Great for networking!!
review: I like this best because you can always find something happening in New York City. It's great to meet new people with similar interest.

title: Great way to spice up a relationship
review: Hubby and I were stuck in a movies-dinner rut. This app helped spice things up by giving up unique date night ideas. Love it!!!

title: Excellent program
review: Love the program very much. It gives me access to a lot of cultural places I've never been to before .

title: Scan
review: Horrible app, false advertising, saw a post on Facebook about an article and when I clicked on it I was taken to the page to download the app and when I downloaded it there was no article just random people and useless information about expensive events that everyone already knows about

title: Find the BEST plans
review: This app is amazing, the events are carefully picked and very original. I found out about amazing art gallery openings and I even got tickets to an exclusive charity event at a discounted price!

title: Best app in the states
review: When I came to the states I couldn't find a fit bird to save my life, but with this app I've found more proper slags than a yob knows what to do with.

title: Love the app
review: I really love this app It gives you a chance to see more of what NewYork city has to offer according to what best suits you and at affordable prices.

title: One thing missing
review: Love this app. the only way to make it better was if there were a way to save events or a search bar

title: Love it
review: Easy to use, like the design + notifications aren't  annoying but rather make you smile

title: Love it
review: Makes life so much easier if you are new and trying to see what the city has to offer. I love it.

title: So useful!
review: A useful app for those like me that live in an awesome city and wish they would take advantage of it more often.

title: Best app for finding parties in NYC!
review: This app is vey helpful when you're planning to go out with your friends in the city and you wanna try somewhere new.

title: Great
review: Theres so many different things that I see on fever . I have been researching some these things previously.

title: Amazing app
review: Keeps me busy and very easy to use. Love this app and will continue to use it and recommend to my friends.

title: Awesome app
review: Im absolutely in love with this app! Definitely something I wish I had found in the beginning of the summer! Kudos to whomever thought of this. Such a great idea!

title: Excellent App for New York events
review: Has a really nice look and tracks a lot of interesting events around New York city. One way of getting to know this great city.

title: Love the app!
review: Great app! If you ever felt like your missing out on some cool events in the city, than get on this app and know what's going on in the city.

title: Unique Events - Bring to Chicago!
review: Frequently use this app when spending time in NYC - perfect for finding unique, out-of-the-box events.  Please bring Fever to Chicago!!

title: Awesome app
review: This app is pretty cool, I like the fact that you can actually see all the people who are going to an event. The pics are great too, very fancy .

title: Awesome App!
review:
Sick app with awesome features. Really a great help to any city night lifer. 
 
Really hoping this hits big because it's an amazing app that's help out so much in such a crazy city.

title: Great customer support
review:
Easy to use app
Great suggestions 
Excellent customer support, always available with live chat

title: Fabulous
review: The events are so fun and a great way to meet new people. This app is a nice way to find ways to interact with people around you

title: WOW!!!

title: Horrible App
review: Went to purchase tickets for an event, but App wouldn‚Äôt allow me to purchase 2 Adult and 1 Senior ticket. Rather than risk not being able to enter event together (This event was Van Gogh Immersive Experience which sold tickets at half an hour intervals.) I purchased 3 adult tickets. When I reached out to Fever I got the same canned response you see on many of the negative reviews. Fever confirmed that App did not allow for a la carte purchases, but refused to issue refund. Can‚Äôt wait for event so I can delete App.if you can avoid using, which I couldn‚Äôt, avoid.

title: Forced to download
review: If you buy a ticket you will not be emailed a QR code but you will be required to get this app. You will also be required to give your full name before entering the app. You will also see two pop ups to ask you to sign up for more stuff before you can get your tickets. Spammy. I'm getting rid of the app as soon as I go to my event.

developerResponse: {'id': 25849210, 'body': 'Hello. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please reach us at customer_satisfaction@feverup.com so we can properly assist you.', 'modified': '2021-10-23T17:40:40Z'}
title: Terrible Customer Service
review:
After accidentally making a purchase for the wrong event, an event they made look A LOT like the actual event I was trying to attend, I messaged customer service about a refund and they responded by saying that they thought a refund wouldn‚Äôt be an issue. So with this information, I did not make an effort to attend the event due to being told I would get my $80 back. Well, I get messaged back by the same unknowledgeable Will at customer service that I would not be getting a refund back, as it says in their Terms of Use.
Though, it‚Äôs very misleadingly, it says they will process the request even though they don‚Äôt honor it? This makes no sense. You either need to say you do or don‚Äôt offer a refund, not both. Their customer service needs to be rechecked and their wording needs to be honored. I feel as a customer, I have been very misled and scammed. Needless to say, I guess I will always be reading those ‚ÄòTerms of Use‚Äô because apps and companies just keep getting more questionable. I have never been so misled or treated with such disrespect by any venue/event organizer/company. I have never gone to purchase tickets for an event where their refund policy is not displayed while doing the purchasing, not buried deep in a very misleading ‚ÄòTerms of Use‚Äô. You think, in these times, companies would more respectful and careful with peoples money. Now I‚Äôm paying for an event I never wanted to attend and going to have to send it to someone that doesn‚Äôt want it, because they only offer you to ‚Äúsend the tickets to a friend‚Äù, or they just scammed me out of $80.

developerResponse: {'id': 25837145, 'body': 'Hello! We regret to hear that your experience with us has not been positive. Please reach us at customer_satisfaction@feverup.com so we can open your case and offer you a suitable solution! ![](https://backend.growthdot.com/reply-after-this/3229285_ccd9d6b8-3f3c-48c6-8e00-067c469d8bb7.gif)\n\nFever Team', 'modified': '2021-10-22T15:51:29Z'}
title: Awful Awful Awful
review: I selected and paid for event tickets. This process was painful. The site forced me to do two separate transactions because it would not allow me to buy Adult and Senior tickets at one time, I then was informed that I had to install this app to access the tickets. This is coercion!  If I knew that I had to do this I would no have bought the tickets,  i DO NOT TRUST any company that forces me to put their app on my phone after I paid for the service, Also. I was not informed of the ticket fee prior to buying the tickets.CROOKS!

title: Sketchy. Don‚Äôt connect your bank info.
review: I used this service to buy tickets to Banksy. The venue was changed and I was unable to attend. I asked for a refund and was given a ‚Äúvoucher‚Äù. When I tried to apply the voucher it would not populate the voucher field and was greyed out. I went through with booking my 2 new tickets but was automatically charged to my linked PayPal. The voucher never applied. I reached out to support and they just kept saying they‚Äôd send this to the sales team. It has been hours and I still have 0 resolution. I submitted a dispute to PayPal but I am still out for the original tickets. I have now paid in full for 4 tickets and will never use them again.

developerResponse: {'id': 25312022, 'body': 'Hola! Por favor ponte en contacto con nosotros en customer_satisfaction@feverup.com para priorizar tu caso y poder asistirte correctamente.', 'modified': '2021-09-25T09:21:33Z'}
title: This company is a scam
review: I bought tickets for the stranger things event happening in a ‚Äúmystery location‚Äù when they first came out and paid premium price for them. Then I found out I was pregnant and my due date is in may so obviously I can‚Äôt go and this is the only event I have interest in attending. Like I said I paid a lot of money for my tickets so when target reviewed my case and they said my tickets were not refundable I was in shock. Now in days of COVID companies are for the most part understanding, they said they could give me a voucher but I need my money back. Do not download this app! ID number 18666645

title: Just email me the QR code
review: Says you can sign up with email, but app only allows login via facebook or google. There‚Äôs no reason they can‚Äôt just email you the tickets. You‚Äôre forced to install an app and use a social login so they can gather as much marketing data about you as possible, send you push notifications, and sign you up for email ads despite clearly declining them at setup.

title: Terrible support team‚Äîfailed to resolve referral code issues
review:
Title says it all. They didn‚Äôt bother figuring out the issue‚ÄîI gave them all the information I have. Instead of solving the issue, they simply closed the ticket and gave me a generic rundown of what I can try to do to troubleshoot (such as reinstalling the app, etc) all of which I already did prior to reaching out. Opened a second ticket as directed and was told to give them information (which I have already given). I gave them the same information‚Ä¶ again (even referencing the previous ticket) but they never got back after.

Lost the chance to purchase tickets at the right price and time. And, as a result, was not able to refer friends to sign up for the app.

title: Unable to access app

title: PISS POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE
review: I will never use this app again. I‚Äôve been a member since 2015 & this is the first time I‚Äôve ever experienced such piss poor customer service. One rep said they will email me codes ‚Ä¶ so I check my email & nothing so I reach back out & SANTIAGO ACOSTA very rudely told me ‚Äúwait two days ‚Ä¶ you need to be more patient‚Äù like what? How dare you? Then I continued to reach back out & got the run around. Atp I just want my refund.

title: FRAUD - Van Gogh NYC
review: They advertise that they are the ONLY ticketing partners for Van Gogh NYC. However, if you actually go to ‚Äúvangoghnyc.com‚Äù you ill find that they specifically state that tickets purchased on Fever are not for their event. Some fishy stuff going on. I hate the weird atmosphere of what this app is, especially with the background of the comments. I know better than to try to get a refund after reading the other experiences people have had here. So i will just say, shame on you. Glad i found this out while i still have time to get tickets to the real event.

We appreciate your patience as our agents are receiving a high volume of contacts and they are getting back to customers to the best of their ability.', 'modified': '2021-04-14T13:54:47Z'}
title: Careful prior to your order
review:
Ordered tickets over the web and was charged.  Then informed that the only way to get the tickets was through the app which doesn‚Äôt run on the iPhone 6 version I have.  And the only way to communicate with fever was through this unsupported app.  Most sites give an alternative for tickets via a non-app solution such as printing at home or emailing the QR code or equivalent.  If fever doesn‚Äôt want to support older versions of an OS then fine, but provide an alternative. Poor experience so far and waiting to hear from support.

4/14/1 - no response from support other than he pro-forma recent posting.  If their strategy is to take your money, not provide you tickets and a timely responses then this company should be removed from apple store.

developerResponse: {'id': 22258012, 'body': 'Hello! We are sorry you feel that way, we want to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences. We have taken a look at your case again and we want to confirm that we have sent a reply to your request, please take a look at your email :)', 'modified': '2021-04-15T09:18:09Z'}
title: Fever up fraud
review:
I saw an ad for Van Gogh Experience in Minneapolis via Fever and purchased two tickets for just under $80. 

When I received the confirmation tickets it said two tickets for a show in Miami. 

I wrote back right away saying they made a mistake, I bought two tickets for the Minneapolis show and I don‚Äôt live in Florida. 

They gave me two ‚Äúcredit vouchers‚Äù that are ONLY good for the Van Gogh Experience which they are not selling for the Minneapolis venue so they are worthless to me. I have bought hundreds of event tickets and have never had a problem.

Please be very careful. I am out $80.00 and I will not buy tickets again through this medium. You are better off sticking with a reputable ticket source.

developerResponse: {'id': 5853413, 'body': 'Hi Tina, thank you so much for the amazing review of the Catacombs by Candlelight tour! We work hard to deliver the best events and experiences :) Thank you for using Fever!', 'modified': '2018-11-08T07:33:07Z'}
title: BEST TOUR EVER
review:
I went on the Catacombs by Candlelight tour
by absolute chance ‚Äî this was one the BEST experiences a history buff can have!!! 
Our guide was amazing ‚Äî ‚Äî organized , FUNNY‚Äî engaging ‚Äî asked FOR questions ‚Äî gave excellent ANSWERS !!!
The Basilica is amazing ‚Äî- if you want to REALLY get some perspective on WHY
there were ‚Äú Gangs of New York‚Äù‚Äî
OMG does this give the true back story .
I am NOT a ‚Äú tour‚Äù person ‚Äî but I would do this again and bring anyone I could with me!!
Kiddos from I‚Äôd say 12 and up would love it‚Äî yes it‚Äôs a bit dark ‚Äî it‚Äôs a CATACOMBS! 
I LOVED THIS!! 
Tina Diffee ‚Äî North Little Rock AR 11/3/18
DO IT!!!

title: Very disappointed
review: Don‚Äôt use this app if there is limited reception/internet at your venue! We were unable to use our ticket because there is no option to print/screenshot the ticket. Without a QR code they wouldn‚Äôt let us in. There was also confusion because neither the app, email nor ticket have the movie title listed.  We wanted to see Trolls but got The Exorcist once we managed to get them to let us in. Wish I could get a refund... disappointed.

title: Refuses to connect with email to get my tickets
review: I just today purchase tickets for the van Gogh exhibit in DC. The only way I can get my tickets us through this app even though you‚Äôre not straightforward about saying that. So I download the app.It says I have not purchased any tickets. It has some  ridiculous email that is an Apple ID email. I try to change the email as it tells me I can to my email where I received my confirmation email. It won‚Äôt let me me. Very frustrating! Looks like an entertainment app and does not provide me with anything that I need.

title: Buyer Beware
review:
I wish I would have read these reviews 1st. I wouldn‚Äôt have purchased tickets. I totally jumped the gun. The app jumps dates. I wound up purchasing the wrong time. There is no one to speak to. You cannot cancel the purchase on your credit card so you are forced to communicate only by email. In addition they don‚Äôt tell you where the venue is. I personally want to know where I am going. 

This is the one and only purchase I will ever make from FEVER unless they change their policies. They have 267.00 of my money and I have to go through aggravation to change the time. THEY WILL NOT GIVE YOU YOUR MONEY BACK. You have to get a voucher and then repurchase your tickets. You may not get the time you wanted. Also if you buy a VIP ticket and change to a regular ticket THEY KEEP THE DIFFERENCE üò≥. In my case I would lose 150.00 bucks. So now I am trying to get a voucher to rebook VIP Tickets. SUPER FRUSTRATING!

title: AVOID!! This business is borderline a scam
review:
Bought four tickets to an event to then learn I needed to repurchase these tickets with a code Fever provided at the organizers website. I paid for tickets + booking fee to find myself having to repeat the process again.
When I try to use the codes to repurchase, the codes do not work. I reach out to an email (email?! second red flag)
They come back to me with a voucher that I can use for same/another event but I have to pay booking fees again. C‚Äômon. That is ridiculous.
This service is three millennials scamming people from a NY apartment with a crappy customer service process.
Avoid this app, go to the organizers site and buy the tickets you want.
Also, the tickets at the organizers site of my event were each 5 dollars less than what I paid.

title: Rip Off
review:
This app effectively charges you for access to URLs where you can buy the ticket to the event you‚Äôre interested in. They make it appear like you‚Äôre paying for a ticket then provide some bogus code to input into the actual event checkout. If you care enough to go to the event anyway you end up paying double and they aren‚Äôt even considerate enough to refund or provide a voucher for what they falsely advertised as a ticket to the event. 

Sign up for some event email lists rather than downloading this and save yourself the headache.

title: Dysfunctional on iOS
review: Don‚Äôt know how this has almost 5 stars. Tried using a google plus account and buying a ticket. Tried to put in a friend‚Äôs code for $10 off, but it kept telling me I had another account and needed to verify that one, but this is my first time using this app. Tried talking to a live rep, who told me only my friend could use their own code, but then 2 of my other friends were able to use the first friend‚Äôs code, so what‚Äôs up with that? Even the reps don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre talking about. Then I tried logging in with FB, but it kept asking me to confirm my email when I tried to buy the ticket, so I could never get to the confirmation screen. Fix your horrible app for the iOS platform and train your staff to be more professional and know what they‚Äôre talking about so you‚Äôll actually make a profit, wouldn‚Äôt that be a good idea?

developerResponse: {'id': 4296121, 'body': "Hi there, we are really sorry you feel this way :( \nSeveral millions of Fever users around the world are very happy with the experience, and we work really hard to help them out, any time, with any doubts or problem they might encounter. Are you sure you don't want to give us a second chance? \nKind regards.", 'modified': '2018-07-18T17:49:15Z'}
title: Something Is Not Right. Fraud?? Con?? I Think So..
review:
I purchased two tickets for an event in Santa Monica, CA scheduled later this month. Afterwards, I received the confirmation email with the Ticket ID number listed, along with instructions on how to get the tickets, with a link provided that re-directs you to the Eventbrite site. The instructions further states, there‚Äôs a promo code to use on Eventbrite. You need to select the same tickets you purchased from Fever, and the total should be $0 during the purchase process on Eventbrite. This is not the case. 

I‚Äôve emailed Fever 3 times. They sent the same confirmation email I received after purchasing the tickets stating the Promo Code and Ticket ID  number is listed. You can‚Äôt download the tickets from the Fever App. It has the same instructions on listed on it, like the email confirmation. 

Who‚Äôs sending the emails out?? I don‚Äôt know if the email is auto generated or what but clearly there wasn‚Äôt a Promo Code, just the Ticket ID number like before.  

I‚Äôm currently waiting to hear back from someone on the Fever team regarding the code, in order for me to get the $140 tickets I paid for. If this is what you have to go through for tickets through this company, don‚Äôt bother. Stay away. It‚Äôs not worth the time you will spend emailing back and forth just to get a Promo Code.

title: Voucher issues for cancelled concert
review:
I am one happy customer due to the great service I received with getting my voucher issues sorted.
I bought my tickets last year not realising I had used a different email to log on to purchase them. As a consequence I didn‚Äôt read the email notification about concert to be cancelled due to Covid. I contacted fever team who assisted me redeem my vouchers. I made another mistake with bookings and mentioned it to Paula@fever who was assisting me not expecting anything. I was pleasantly surprised when told they‚Äôd look into it straightaway and resolved that issue as well! I now am able to purchase tickets using the vouchers to a concert of my choice. 
Thank you very much fever team. Made me confident to purchase tickets with Fever for future events due to great customer support and service!

title: Fantastic service!
review: Couldn‚Äôt recommend this app more highly. In addition to the great discount program and ease of purchasing tickets, the customer service is excellent. I‚Äôve used great apps before in relation to content, but the customer service when you need assistance was shocking and stopped using them. No issues with that with this app. It‚Äôs soooo easy and helpful to get assistance. (Note this is the first time I think I‚Äôve left a review for anything, that‚Äôs how grateful I am).

developerResponse: {'id': 22303965, 'body': 'Hello, we are sorry that you feel that way. We have checked your case and we can confirm that it is been sorted already by one of our agents. We are very sorry for the inconveniences caused. Best regards,', 'modified': '2021-04-18T11:19:46Z'}
title: Worst app and customer service ever
review:
It‚Äôs been the worst experience I ever had with an events app.

I first bought two tickets to go to a candlelight concert. The concert was canceled due to rain and so the event people told us, they changed the date of our tickets and, in the case that we couldn‚Äôt attend that day, to contact fever up to reschedule. Unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt attend to the new date so I contacted fever up several times to get my tickets rescheduled as there was another event later on, after two weeks of trying to reach out to them, didn‚Äôt get an answer and lost the opportunity to attend the concert as they replied to me when there were no dates available anymore. When I asked for a refund they just gave me a voucher to use in another event.

After a while, I saw another event in which I wasn't too  interested but I had to use the voucher, right? So I went in and try to purchase two tickets with the voucher. I had so many errors in the app and they ended up charging me $135 in my bank card and only use a bit of the voucher!! SO FRUSTRATING 
Now they don‚Äôt want to refund me the $135. So they‚Äôre basically stealing from me. Terrible.

Fever up- is that how you make money? Charging users mistakenly and making them use that money again in your terrible app?

This will obviously be raised with consumer affairs.

developerResponse:
{'id': 21574301, 'body': 'Hello Isaac. Thank you for your review.
We always aim to deliver a great experience. We are gutted when we miss the mark! Thanks for taking the time to bring this to our attention.
We will email you soon to compensate you for this unpleasant experience and will use your feedback to make us better and to ensure this doesn‚Äôt happen again.
Best regards,', 'modified': '2021-03-10T20:17:54Z'}
title: Very disappointing experience
review:
I booked tickets to "Candlelight Open Air: Chopin‚Äôs Best Works" for myself and my partner. I was drawn in by the advertised candle lit park overlooking the river, and bought the best tickets I could seated closest to the water (as detailed on the seating plan). I booked the event in time with sunset in view of the setting. I have never before been more disappointed in my life when we arrived at the venue. The candle lit park overlooking the water had been replaced by what looked like didgy school hall you would be embarrassed to see your kids music recital in. 

Upon arrival the staff didn't know where to direct us after receiving our tickets, we were eventually shown to a spare row of uncomfortable plastic chairs that protested with loud screeches at the slightest of movement. 

The performance dragged on for an uninspiring hour punctuated only by the extremely regular screeches of the cheap decor, the hacking sound of the ancient aircondition looming over the already low ceilings like some sort of evil spirit, and regular unsilenced phone calls and covid sounding dry coughs.

I have never been more embarrassed to have invited someone to such a garbage event. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app or their events

title: Dodgy service - BEWARE!
review: I had my tickets automatically change to 8.30 from the 6.30 tickets I purchased without checking if this was ok. As soon as I and my friends realised the day before they were able to change theirs back however the agent Audra said it was impossible and indicated I needed to attend that time as there were no more times available. She did indicate I could attend another fever event for the same price however she didn‚Äôt appear to understand that people purchase tickets for things they would like to see. No offer of refund at all. BEWARE - super dodgy and it looks like they can change the time of your ticket at any stage

developerResponse: {'id': 28092885, 'body': "Hello. We're sorry that your experience with us has not been the best. We will forward your comments to the appropriate department for them to take them into account in the future. Regards,", 'modified': '2022-02-16T22:24:23Z'}
title: Tried to change date
review:
Could not change the date, despite falling ill and then could not get a refund for the event. It was within 48h, but the event is a continuous 3 month nightly thing that you walk into (it‚Äôs a light show in a park, not like I was taking up a seat in a concert or something) so to change the date should not have been a problem.
They should look into having a different cancellation/refund service based on the type of event. This was very disappointing and felt very cold and corporate as a response. 
Customer service was good if a little slow.

title: Good events and good for keeping your tickets in the app but app is buggy with purchases
review:
Good events but dangerously the app has one-click purchasing if your bank details have been saved. I accidentally clicked on an event and purchased a ticket. Fever would not refund. There is no safe guard or confirmation required. 

I also woke up one morning to be delighted to know I had purchased a ticket to an event while I was asleep!!  Still waiting to hear back from Fever in that one. 

My tip is don‚Äôt trust the app with your payment details. Pay individually each time you make an event purchase.

developerResponse: {'id': 23520594, 'body': "Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Sally! However, booking fees are applied per ticket, not per transaction, which means that even if you purchased the tickets altogether, the total bookings fees would be the same. If you're still needing assistance, feel free to get in touch with customer_satisfaction@feverup.com :)\n\nFever Team", 'modified': '2021-06-22T09:53:57Z'}
title: Terrible app
review: The events seem good but the app itself is terrible. The per ticket booking fees add up and to buy multiple ticket types then you have to do it in different transactions and be charged a hefty fee each time. That doesn‚Äôt seem to be displayed on the screen or invoice very clearly either. No refunds at all (even when the clunky user experience and check out cart is the reason why). While you can get a credit, you then get charged to use it ($14). You also can‚Äôt transfer a credit to different events. Overall an awful experience.

title: Horrible, event cancelled and no notification of rescheduling or refund
review:
Don‚Äôt book tickets through this!

An event I purchased tickets for was cancelled because of Covid in Melbourne. I was waiting for an email or notification telling me when it would be rescheduled but the only email I got eventually was asking me how I enjoyed the event and to rate it‚Ä¶ I did not enjoy it, because I did not attend because I wasn‚Äôt told it was rescheduled. Unfortunately, I was really excited for this and now I‚Äôm just disappointed and bitter. They also never refunded a ticket mixup. Just awful.

title: Cancelled concert
review: Our concert was cancelled due to lockdown restrictions. They not only offered replacement tickets for same concert, same venue just another date, but also equivalent tickets to any other concert if replacement date did not suit.  Great service, no questions asked.

I will delete it as soon as I‚Äôve been to the event as they insist on storing your tickets rather than emailing them like any other normal non-data-mining event company. The UX has had little thought too, it‚Äôs like taking a step back in time. Massive thumbs down from me.

title: Money grabber
review:
Fever doesn‚Äôt allow you to book different ticket types in the one booking e.g. adults and seniors going to the same session. You have to buy the adult tickets as one booking and the senior tickets as another booking. 

And you get charged a booking fee for each booking - double dipping! 

And, as another complainant has stated ‚Äì your credit card details are automatically stored. No option given. Not good for credit card security! 

All in all, Fever lacks a professional touch. 

I‚Äôll be deleting the app as soon as I attend the event and no longer need the app in order to access the tickets.

title: Tread Carefully!
review: A warning to those who save their bank details on the Fever App: Be very careful when browsing for tickets, particularly musicals! When you are looking at what dates/times/sections are available and how many seats are remaining for each, this is also the final purchase confirmation page. So if you accidentally hit the purchase button while you are still deciding what you would like to order, Fever will charge you for those tickets and not refund them. Tread carefully people!

review:

Bought a ticket, Seating A worth AUD $67 ($75 less $8 discount from previous purchase) for a candlelight event (Vivaldi) in Adelaide.  Checked my bank and I got charged Au$107.47

Support has been very slow and abysmal. Case is still unresolved!

title: Guys please be careful !!!!!!!!!!!! Don‚Äôt book with them!!!!
review:
They change the concert time and date without give you a notice, 
My booking is on 16/12 /7: 30 pm, and they secretly change my tickets from the app to 20/12 4:30pm on 15/12( a day before the concert).Without give us any notice.

When we asking the refund from them ,and ask if they can refund me to another of my account(because after I book the tickets with them, my card details and money be stolen, so I did cancel this card) they refused my request , and I told them I will write my reviews on their Facebook page but they just told me ‚Äú do whatever you want ‚Äú and close my call.

When I check the page I found out so many people have the same bad situation like me, they wrote the bad reviews to show the people how they cheat us but after 1 hour, fever delete all the reviews from their Facebook page!!

and I notice someone write here said be careful with your bank details on this app, it‚Äôs true!!!!!! because after I book my tickets with them ,someone stole my card details and my money from my account!!!!!!

Guys please please be careful and don‚Äôt book with them!!! I am sure this company can not be trust!!!

title: Great App & Great Customer Service!
review: I‚Äôm over the moon to find Fever, usually I search for hours looking for cool & interesting things to go & see, & by accident I came across Fever, which has now cut my search time online by 90%. Fever provides me with the coolest events in my city, easy to book, & at great prices. Additionally when I bought my first tickets the other day, I made a mistake in my order, contacted customer service, actually spoke to a person who really cared about my experience with their company, and my mistake was rectified straight away. Love this company already!

title: Hands down one of the worst companies I‚Äôve ever dealt with
review: My phone was unlocked in my pocket and somehow managed to book a ¬£50 event ticket on Fever. I realised as it was happening and tried closing the app and refreshing as there was no cancel button, but frustratingly the booking went through. It was a Saturday, I tried every means of contacting them (email, phone etc) immediately after, explaining exactly what happened, to no avail. It took weeks of my persistent chasing (calling their phone which was never answered) before finally getting a response and then they refused to help or do anything about it. They wouldn‚Äôt even consider exchanging the money into credit to use on the app for other future event bookings. They were grossly unhelpful, unsympathetic and did nothing to resolve or compensate the situation which arose because they had an extremely insecure booking system. I will never use them again and would encourage others to steer clear of them - if anything goes wrong with your booking their customer service is appalling, they have no respect for their customers which is a shame as I had previously been a loyal customer and regularly made bookings through the app. But the second there was a mistake they couldn‚Äôt have cared less.

title: Awful errors straight off the bat
review: Got the recommended app when I saw the advertisement for the Titanic exhibition coming soon and chose the option to ‚ÄòContinue with Apple I.D‚Äô instead of creating an account using my email address. Because I did this, it‚Äôs created an email address from my Apple I.D that I can‚Äôt get emails through. I try to change my email address on my profile and it won‚Äôt allow me to. Now, when I book for the event, it tells me they‚Äôve sent an email with all the info to my ‚Äòemail address‚Äô which is the wrong one. Also, after signing up for the Titanic Waitlist on the website before getting the app, I got an email with a ¬£5 off voucher. When I add it to the app, it is not recognised and can‚Äôt be used! There is absolutely nothing about a time limit for the voucher on the email. FIX THESE ISSUES PLEASE. Not a good first impression!! Update: the Fever customer service is some of the worst I have ever experienced. Although they do email back, in every single email it is very clear that they haven‚Äôt read my emails properly and so suggest things I have previously told them I‚Äôve done. Absolute waste of time and no help at all.

title: Excellent customer service
review:
I bought tickets for an event late at night (after a bottle of wine-oops) and realised that I chose the wrong time slot. Having read that the tickets were unrefundable I tried contacting customer service through the in app chat thinking I was just going to be turned down. 
At midnight I was chatting with a customer service lady then via email, up until this morning, and now... I‚Äôve got the slot I wanted! They cancelled my ticket and issued a voucher for the same amount I spent, it was all much easier than I imagined. Very pleased and looking forward to the event! 
The only downside of the app is that I feel that it is easily done to book the wrong date/time slot. When you go back to a previous page it resets the chosen date/time to the first available instead of the one that you had chosen. So you need to keep checking. I wish that it would say in every page what slot/date you were booking up until the confirmation of payment page. Just a heads up.

title: Refuses refund for missold restaurant tickets
review: I bought tickets for a restaurant using the app date and time search. I did this to Limit my search results to restaurants available on the date I searched for . The restaurant has now confirmed they are not accepting these tickets until after holiday season Fever is refusing to refund me even though there was NO notice of this issue with the restaurant on their app Fever are quick to take payments but then unreasonably try to refuse the refund and delaying dealing with matters. This sort of situation should not happen and if it does customers should be able to rely on a professional response with an immediate refund (like Groupon ). I would very strongly advise customers not to use this app. I will end up at small claims court wasting everyone‚Äôs time if this is not resolved . Completely unacceptable service

title: Surprised!
review: After you book an event, make sure you check the address. Two out of two times address was incorrect, to be precise there were to addresses there, I‚Äôve had to contact the support. Then I wanted to cancel one of the events, they did and said they sent me confirmation, to the wrong email address. I am still puzzled where it went. In the end, I‚Äôve missed both events on that day. Lastly, they‚Äôve issued a voucher with an expiry date of 24 hours, but nowhere was it stated that it was that. I contacted the support, they said my money have expired, but I didn‚Äôt attend the event!?! They have reopened the ticket and gave me a further 24 hours. When you live in London, 24 hours is a very short time. Also, there is no facility to see this in your account, they send you a very long email, figure it out yourself. I won‚Äôt be using the app again.

title: SCAM - they will take your money and no refund
review: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but I feel I need to warn other users not to book through this company. I booked tickets to an event that Fever subsequently cancelled. They then issued me a voucher to rebook the same cancelled event...  I paid ¬£100 for the tickets and the amount they decided to give me in vouchers is ¬£50?! Their customer service response was that their tickets are non-refundable... As I wasn‚Äôt the one that cancelled the event, it‚Äôs appalling that they won‚Äôt refund the money - I paid for a service I am not going to receive through no fault of my own. Customer service agents clearly have a poor comprehension of English as I have explained my situation to them, only to receive the same response that they will not refund my money. Please stay away from this company - it‚Äôs a moneymaking scam.

review:

The show could also last 20-30 minutes more, as it‚Äôs so enjoyable and fun -guess the artists would be stretching even more. 
Please do come to London as would love to take my friends to enjoy it too! (And for my family and me to repeat üòâ)
Muchas gracias üòä

title: Customer service is poor
review: Great app for cheap codes and recommend to others as great prices however customer service is very poor that why I‚Äôm reviewing at 1 star and they take far to long to get back to you so if you need help. you may not get an immediate response,  in terms of vouchers I would highly recommend for the cinema but the customer service let‚Äôs this app down big time! Had been using them for a while and Could do with improving at times felt as through one person I spoke with was treating it as a joke when I didn‚Äôt receive my ticket . If you don‚Äôt need help then you‚Äôre be okay otherwise might be better off using app groupon where the customer service is much better and it‚Äôs taken more seriously when you‚Äôd spent your money .

title: The best!
review:
I can‚Äôt rate FEVER event app enough, from the second I researched some fun evening events I. London I was led to FEVER and I‚Äôm so glad I was as there the exact type of chilled but fun filled London nights I was after, as well as being well priced too!

title: Fundamentally flawed and poor customer service
review:
The app is fundamentally flawed by no apparent way to add multiple tickets to your order. yes, there may be a group or family ticket option, but this is more expensive if there are only two of you and potentially excludes someone else from an event. 

I tried to book tickets for a very popular event. Family tickets were still available, indicating that there would be at least one adult and one child ticket available. But, in the time it took me to book on ticket (remember, no way to add a second of a different type to the order), the event had sold out, rendering my single ticket useless.

I was promised an exchange voucher which did not materialise.

title: Annoying, Over-controlling App.
review: The website for a large event event in Brussels redirects to Fever to buy tickets.   As far as I could see, Fever wouldn‚Äôt let me use a basket to collect a set of different ticket types and each required a separate transaction.  Be careful, as the date and time for the ticket resets each time and it would be too easy to buy a ticket for the wrong time.  Once purchased there was no option to have the tickets delivered by email alone.  The receipt only allows download of tickets by forcing you to download the Fever app.  The App itself may turn out to be just fine, but I really didn‚Äôt like the way Fever compels you to download the app to get the tickets.

There are loads of events on Fever I haven‚Äôt even seen advertised elsewhere, so I wouldn‚Äôt even know about them unless I had this app. Very useful for ideas when stuck for things to do.

It‚Äôs a marketing and payment system masquerading as a booking website‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt receive any confirmation, reminder or notification about a ¬£70 concert so I guess it will be up to you to mark it down on your calendar and contact the venue/organiser for details and updates. title: Not worth it.
review: I never usually write reviews at all but feel compelled to. I booked an event from Fever. First, the event time changed 1 week before the event to 6pm instead of 7pm which caused difficulties in scheduling. Second, the event then started late at 7:15pm after rushing to get there at the earlier start date. The speaker really wasn‚Äôt worth the money and the organisation of the event was terrible - lack of staff at the venue and nobody responsible on the day who ticket holders could turn to. Tried to raise things with customer services, ignored all of my emails and then sent one saying that there was nothing they were willing to do - not even an apology. To avoid disappointment, don‚Äôt bother.

title: Serial killer online talk with Adam and Chris
review:
This was a really excellent talk. Please keep more of these online talks going as the new, post covid ‚Äònormal‚Äô. 
I love things like this & have been able to listen to a lot more talks on various topics since lockdown. 
It‚Äôs more financially viable for lots of people who live in the burbs as often travel costs time mixed with work commitments prevent people attending. 
Streaming has to be the way forward for so many of the arts now.

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: Cannot fault the customer service . I booked the wrong tickets . Sent a message not really expecting a response. However the response was immediate & couldn‚Äôt be more helpful . Cancelled my tickets gave me a voucher to re purchase the correct tickets . My only gripe is that it is easy to purchase the wrong tickets the way the App presents them . Definitely use again but will more attention to what I‚Äôm ordering

title: Poor customer service
review: I never write reviews for anything but I felt compelled to write this one. I‚Äôve never used the app before, had it for absolutely ages though but last week I spotted a competition running for some free tickets and thought why the hell not. To cut to the chase, I was slightly confused by an email they sent and I contacted their customer support to clarify, I was polite and grateful for their prompt response BUT the rep was on full defence mode. She spoke to me like I was the dumbest thing on the planet or I‚Äôd personally offended her by asking her to clarify something. No manners whatsoever, customer service is the heart of any organisation and a bad rep can ruin a company - please focus on training your reps.

title: Poor flexibility and customer service.
review: My event was cancelled due to storm.  Which is fair.  they issued a voucher but they charged AGAIN extra from booking fee (totalled nearly ¬£40).  My friend wasn‚Äôt able to get the same ticket as me for the future event, had to go tier lower, even though the app didn‚Äôt mention.  There was a -¬£60 difference in the price between tiers but didn‚Äôt give her the money back!  So not only did they charge an additional fee we paid with the original tickets they stole ¬£50 of her money!! Poor show.  Shame that this is the only provider of tickets.  Avoid if possible!

title: Opened my eyes !!!
review: Didn‚Äôt realise so much went on in Liverpool that I was unaware of. I can now start organising events with close friends and we all know what‚Äôs going on! I left social media last year so have been a bit out of the loop with them so now I can send invites to things I know we can all meet up to. Love this app it‚Äôs so informative and easy to use.

title: If I could give it 0, I would.
review: I think quite possibly the worst customer experience I‚Äôve ever received. Fever decided to move the event (not me) and not email to notify me. I had 0 communication and had to find out myself via chat. At that point no one notified me about the ability to refund. All I could get was an exchange voucher. Trying to exchange for like for like event price and now they‚Äôre deciding to charge ¬£6.80 per ticket booking fee. Why am I paying extra for something when it wasn‚Äôt my decision to move the event? Your decision to move the event, so we should not be out of pocket.

title: No customer service
review: I booked tickets to an event in August - but due to Corona the event was rescheduled. I cannot attend the new date as I‚Äôm away and I have been trying to get in touch with Fever to arrange a refund for the last three weeks - I have emailed, messaged on live chat in the app and also sent messages on Facebook. While I appreciate that they have a lot of people to speak to the lack of communication is disappointing - and they have simply assumed everyone is available on the new date. Won‚Äôt be booking tickets via Fever again given the extremely poor customer service.

title: Random Followers Feature should NOT be an Automatic function!!!
review:
Random Followers Feature should NOT be an Automatic function!!! Deleting App!!!

App Developers - take note that the Random Followers Feature should NOT be an Automatic function!!!

Why would you allow such a function!!! I used my FB profile as my login which I have locked down for a reason & now I have RANDOM UNKNOWN followers following me!!! Without any ability whatsoever to be able to stop!!!

I understand why you may wish to share an event with KNOWN Friends who use the app ... but why would you just allow ANY RANDOM STRANGER to follow someone without giving them the option to choose ‚ÄúNo I do not know this person & no I do NOT want them following me!!!‚Äù

Great app for buying tickets & checking out what‚Äôs on but this ‚ÄúFollowers‚Äù Feature i think is an invasion of privacy & should NOT be allowed!!!

DELETING App!!!

title: Refunded - great customer service
review: The venue web site transferred my booking to a different day / different event on purchase as original selection was sold out - View from the Shard - their web site is very poor. I was really cross that they had not made the change in date clearer. However Fever agreed to process a refund for me.

title: Brilliant app and great customer service
review: If you‚Äôre looking for loads of activities to do and cool things to find across cities worldwide, this is the app for you. Searching and booking is really easy, and the customer support resolves any issues rapidly. I will recommend this app to all.

title: Very helpful!!!

Avoid this app at all costs, it‚Äôs really a 3rd party app, that only sends you to the original event organiser.

title: Wade
review:
It‚Äôs the first time I‚Äôve booked through Facebook app as I didn‚Äôt have a google account to pay 
the show I‚Äôm going to is in three weeks it‚Äôs all paid for 
Why do I have to call the venue to confirm I will be arriving on the date I‚Äôve paid for 
As I‚Äôm told when I‚Äôve downloaded the app and looked at my booking 
As follows 
Please note you must call ahead to confirm your booking followed by phone number / email 

I‚Äôve paid and have confirmation of payment and downloaded the app as was told not all venues accept emails as confirmation 

Yet another hurdle and I‚Äôm 3 weeks away from a birthday treat for my missus 

How about getting your house in order fever and guaranteed tickets your customers who have been charged 
Alarm bells 
#godirectorprovemewrongfever

title: AVOID - Terrible App
review:
I have no idea how this app had the rating it does, due to the fact I found it on Facebook, I can only assume they have a large budget for marketing and therefore have also paid for fake reviewers.

The app is awful. Use Time Out instead.

It is buggy, there are only paid events, you can only sign up with social media, they store your card information in the app without your permission and it‚Äôs incredibly easy to accidentally buy tickets. 

Their customer service agents are not friendly or helpful as many of these reviews would suggest. I think the fact that the developers are replying only to those who are leaving positive reviews here reflects this.

Seriously, Time Out is better in every way :)

title: Theives and terrible customer service
review:
TLDR: Tried to say i had bought something when i hadn‚Äôt and then ignored my requests for a complaints process. 

Recently I received a email regarding cinema tickets from fever and believing it to be an offer disregarded it. The next day pay pal informed me Fever had taken a transaction from me. I looked on the app (which I hadn‚Äôt opened since November when i used it to purchase tickets for an event) to find a single ticket for cinema tickets for around the m25 (or something like that). I was completely dumbfounded. I immediately emailed Fever and their response has been shocking. They basically told me that they didn‚Äôt believe me and in any case i still had some time left on the ticket so all‚Äôs good! Incensed i then began to look at the purchase date on the ticket, it was before i even downloaded the app. When i went back to Fever they sent me a snotty email telling me that they had taken the usual move of refunding my money but that i should delete my payment method from the app. Why would i need to delete my payment method when as they say purchases aren‚Äôt completed without authorisation?! While i was incredibly angry i had got my money back and made sure to delete everything related to the app and asked for the complaints process so as to make sure this wouldn‚Äôt happen to someone else. The customer service ignored my email refusing to give me any complaints details. I reported the app and gave up. Since then i have been receiving emails on a regular basis from Fever something that i did not opt in for. I have asked to be taken off the mailing list especially considering I don‚Äôt even have the app anymore!!! And i have asked for my data to be erased. I guess we‚Äôll see if they can manage that although if my experience with them is anything to go by i guess I‚Äôll be ignored to have to report them again!

title: Great app
review: I downloaded this app after seeing an ad on Facebook because one cannot have enough of these apps. Within the first 2 hours of having the app, I purchased tickets to an event and attended it late that say. and had a great time, in a place that's unique and good value for money. It's one of those apps where, if you have a day off and haven't quite made any plans and you have a friend in a similar situation you can just scroll through and your sorted. I can imagine this app being brilliant for dates. Anyways, I like it and I have found it very useful.

title: Please read this review before purchase
review:
Downloaded the app after seeing it on Facebook. It appeared to offer some pretty neat events in London that I wouldn't otherwise have knowledge of.  Spotted an event that I had to pay ¬£10 per person for and turned up to find the venue closed with no signs of life. Yet the even is suggesting it's sold out. We then later discovered that the even was further down the street at a different event and was actually a PRIVATE PARTY! I will be complaining and I will be getting my money back for time and effort gone into travelling to the event in the first place! I hate to give it even 1 star but I actually don't have a choice. The app should be operated a lot better. Reminds me of groupons early days.

By way of an update: I was fortunate enough to purchase tickets through PayPal and have since opened a dispute. Today is the last day of the dispute and the seller or the owner of the app has not made any contact either directly or via PayPal to resolve the issue. This app is a fraud! And I will be awarded a refund following the dispute. So should you opt still to go ahead with your purchase of an event I strongly suggest you do it through PayPal to protect yourself in the event that you have a similar experience.
